programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy helps government agents search for a herd of 625 stolen horses intended for the Spanish-American War.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Cattlemen and sheep herders threaten to start a range war.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A marshal accuses a brother and sister of passing counterfeit notes.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A likable young man idolizes an infamous criminal.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt unknowingly appoints a man hired to kill him as a policeman.

programme.title: Man of the West
programme.desc: A reformed Texas outlaw (Gary Cooper), a con man and a singer (Julie London) meet the outlaw's old gang.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt uncovers a crime ring while investigating a murder.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A man promises a girl her weight in gold if she marries him.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Mexican-American hostility stands in the way of a young girl's love.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt almost lands at the bottom of the bay while trying to catch a gang of shanghaiing sailors.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: A saloon singer (Ann Dvorak) and her rival like a marshal (Randolph Scott) who cleans up a drunken sheriff's (Edgar Buchanan) cow town.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.sub-title: The Lost Treasure of Canyon Town
programme.desc: A visit to Micah's old home leads to the uncovering of an old mystery.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas, temporarily blind, faces a gunfight.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy Derringer returns to New Orleans to save his mansion from a carpetbagging Reconstruction overlord.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Charged with cleaning up the notorious Gallatin Street, Yancy Derringer finds himself once again at odds with Toby Cook, owner of the Jumping Jack Casino.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley attempts to escort Yancey Lewis, a bank robber sentenced to spend five years in prison in a distant town.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley's old friend, pretty ranch owner Martha Driscoll, negotiates a highly successful sale at the end of a cattle drive.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill Longley returns from a cattle drive and discovers an impostor has stolen his mail, destroyed a saloon and dallied with a pretty girl, causing his father to demand a shotgun wedding.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley has just ridden into the town of Yellow Jacket, when he sees a gunman unhitching a team of horses over the loud objections of a pretty woman.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Wylie Ames, a big gruff widower, has been corresponding with a lonely woman whose personal ad he saw in an out-of town paper.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: A crooked gambler with a Kentucky-born thoroughbred prods a drunken rancher into betting his entire spread and all the money he has in the bank on a horse race.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: A lone frontiersman (James Stewart) risks his life to forge peace between Arizona settlers and Cochise's (Jeff Chandler) Apache nation.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley rides to the rescue when four gunmen ambush a man riding in a buggy; Longley brings the wounded man to a nearby house, but nobody wants to help him because he's a judge scheduled to preside over the trial of a local land baron.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley, trapped by a landslide, is rescued by a man on the run from the law; he's accused of shooting a man, but the sheriff just assumed he's guilty because he's already served a jail term -- and he's sweet on the sheriff's sister.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley and Acosta travel to San Thomas to bid on a shipment of rifles and ammunition; they're outbid by a beautiful blonde woman working for a notorious gun runner; Longley and Acosta must now prevent the gunrunner's plans to arm the Apaches.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley stumbles across a cabin and its dead owner; the dead man's brothers believe Longley to be the killer and are preparing to string him up when he's rescued by a stranger.

programme.title: The Cheyenne Social Club
programme.desc: Two cowboys (James Stewart, Henry Fonda) ride from Texas to Wyoming to claim an inheritance which turns out to be a brothel.

programme.title: The Gambler Wore a Gun
programme.desc: The new owner (Jim Davis) of a ranch has a problem with the deed, caused by a noose.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: After someone shoots at Hoppy and Red in a seemingly deserted town, they discover that the town's only resident has been shot and left for dead.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy and Red resolve to help local ranchers against an exploiter who wants to take over Stone Valley and sell it to the cavalry.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Drought threatens cattlemen and the banker extending their credit.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A banker asks Hoppy to trap robbers hijacking gold shipments.

programme.title: Guns of the Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: A mercenary (George Kennedy) recruits a knife man (James Whitmore), a gunman (Monte Markham) and four outlaws to free a Mexican patriot from prison.
